help-file.title: RACEWARS PKILL PLAYERKILL
help-file.content:
Duris consists of a delicately balanced To make these wars possible, player-killing (aka pkill) is tolerated and even encouraged, subject to rules described below.
The good races consist of (Grey Elves, Mountain Dwarves, Gnomes, Halflings, Centaurs, Barbarians, Half-Elves and Humans). Undead races include (Vampires, Liches, Wights, Shadow Beasts, Death Knights, Phantoms, Revenants and Shades). Evil races are (Drow Elves, Duergar Dwarves, Swamp Trolls, Ogres, Orcs, Goblins and Githyankis). Alltogether, there are three neutral races in the Land of Duris, (Minotaurs, Thri-Kreens and Harpies). Minotaurs and Thri-Kreens may choose either the good or e il side of the racewar when rolling a character. But, Harpies all enter the world as a neutral race until they complete a quest to seal their fate in Duris.
These sides are at constant war with one another, in an attempt to take over all of Duris. Each race will have its own home city and the city's inhabitants are aggressive to the races of the other side. For example, if you are a Grey Elf and try to enter Archdrathos (the city of the Drow Elves) you will be attacked on sight by the drow mobs, guardians of the city and possibly drow players. The same holds true for ALL cities of the realms.
Outside of those cities, however, is a dangerous place. You never know who or what will be waiting for you on the other side of the city walls. You will quickly find that traveling in groups is the best way to survive. As to who can attack who, anyone CAN attack anyone.
Evil and Undead races will have a much harder time on Duris than the Good races do. Most are blind on the surface world during the day, suffering from the pureness of daylight. Furthermore, life will be cruel and harsh on them. It will be substantially more difficult for ANYONE of an evil or undead race to make it to a high level, let alone reach the surface and kill anyone. As you can see, there will be plenty of ordeals for these races to overcome before they will have the chance to prey on others. In addition, ANY evil-raced person on the surface will be hunted down by powerful good-raced PC's and killed on sight.
This is a VERY brief description of how race wars work on Duris. The more intricate details will be revealed as they unfold.
